result.execSummary:
The defendant Mindy S. Kraus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Unpaid Restitution - Civil Judgment - Reduced by any payment made since restitution order.
Unpaid Restitution - Civil Judgment - Reduced by any payment made since restitution order.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Existing period of supervision.

miscConds.notes: Total Restitution in the amount of $2088.02 is to be repaid in the following manner:  $307.80 is to be paid directly to the victim and $1780.22 is to be paid to Network Health Plan.  Restitution is to be paid in increments of not less than $100.00 per month, commencing March 1, 2016.  Victim is to be paid in full prior to any payments being forwarded to Nethwork Health Plan.    In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with the victim as named in the Complaint.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

timeConds.notes: No Good Time Credit.  Huber Privileges granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Work Release and Good Time credit granted. Court approves release for child care within the rules of work release program of the jail.  Balance of sentence to be served forthwith.

Court Costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid in the amount of $644.80.   Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Unpaid Restitution ordered converted to a civil judgment in the total amount of $1992.79.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 15CF-143 and 17CM-67 - Both Cases Called @ 11:45 AM:  15CF-143:  Counsel admits receipt of Rev Ord and Warrant - no factual corrections or errors offered.  Counsel agree with TS credit.  Joint Agreement on resolution recited.   Def and counsel concur with State's recital.  17CM-67:    Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. 17CM-67 - Ct Nos 1 and 2 As Charged Pleas:  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Record sufficient to establish Repeat Offender modification.  Victim Rights in Compliance as to both filed.  No statement offered by Defendant.  The Court:  15CF-143:  1 yr WCJ - 123 days TS credit, Work Release and GT credit any financial obligation unfilled are reimposed.  Restitution as to victim ordered converted to civil judgment to the extent not paid.  17CM-67:  S/W - 2 yrs probation.  Conditions:   Anger Mgmt completion as prescribed by Agent;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, no argumentative or confrontational contact with victim (SP) due to complicated medical situation of child their in common.  Work Release privileges as per the rules of the Jail - solely up to the Jail as to whether can be exercised for child care.  Court approves child care within work release rules. Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.  DNA Sample on File.  Surcharge Assessed.  Appeal Rights Given.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 3:46 PM: Defendant Mindy S. Kraus in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by DA.  Def and counsel confirm resolution.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Elements of offense explained.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed - victim present and declines statement.   Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 DRI.  Argument by DA.  Argument by SPD - confirms current supervision.  Statement by Def:   None offered.  The Court:  S/W - 3 yrs probation - concurrent to Winnebago Co supervision.  Conditions:  35 days WCJ - No GT/No TS credit, Report 7/1/16 @ 8:00 PM, Huber granted; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Rest $2088.02 - $307.80 to victim - balance of $1780.22 to NHP - to be repaid in increments of no less than $100 per mo commencing 3/1/2016 - Rest paid first to victim then to NHP - victim repaid first; No contact with victim; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP; DNA on file - Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Appeal Rights Given

NOT PUT OF RECORD. Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi request plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Case Called @ 1:45 PM: Defendant Mindy S. Kraus in court, in custody and remains on PO Hold, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of preliminary hearing in its entirety.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   ARGN to proceed.  NGP rec'd and entered.  Def serving sanction SEH with release date of 11/16/15.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 09:20 am.
Restitution Summary and Statement of Loss/Damage - $3673.06
